original: yang na 'khor lo 'di rnams yi ge re re'i mthar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang na 'khor lo 'di rnams yi ge re re'i mthar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid kyang ngo //

original: slar yang dgos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slar yang 'khor lo drug pa'i phyi rol du sngags kyi 'khor lo bdun pa gsungs pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro'o //

analyzed: gzhan du na 'joms par 'gyur ro //

original: dam pa'i chos mi bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mi bden par 'gyur ro //

original: 'di ni rdo rje phag mo'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje phag mo'i tshig go //

analyzed: de'i rjes su sems gcig dgang bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig gsungs pa /

original: dbyangs lnga pa'i /
analyzed: dbyangs lnga pa'i /
translated: The fifth vowel [is placed]

original: drung na gnas pa'i stan la ni //
analyzed: drung na gnas pa'i stan la ni //
translated: ‚Äúon the seat below it.‚Äù

original: au'i yi ge dbyangs kyi lnga pa'i drung na gnas pa ni a'u'i yi ge'i stan can no //
analyzed: au'i yi ge dbyangs kyi lnga pa'i drung na gnas pa ni a'u'i yi ge'i stan can no //
translated: The letter Au, which is below the fifth vowel, is the seat of the letter A.

original: zla dum thig les brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zla dum thig les brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with a half-moon and a drop.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed pa dang thig les brgyan pa ste mdor na h'um gi yi ge'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed pa dang thig les brgyan pa ste mdor na h'um gi yi ge'o //
translated: This means that it is adorned with a half-moon and a drop. In brief, it is the letter H≈™M.

original: cho gas de kho na'i sa bon zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i cho gas de kho na nyid kyi sa bon te stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: cho gas de kho na'i sa bon zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i cho gas de kho na nyid kyi sa bon te stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe seed of reality by this method‚Äù means that the seed of reality, which is the nature of emptiness and compassion, is by this method.

original: pa yi drung gnas pa'i sa bon //
analyzed: pa yi drung gnas pa'i sa bon //
translated: The seed ‚Äúon the side of the Pa‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni pa'i yi ge'i logs na gnas pa ni pha'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pa'i yi ge'i logs na gnas pa ni pha'i yi ge'o //
translated: means that the letter Pha is on the side of the letter Pa.

original: rnal 'byor ma tshogs skyod byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma tshogs skyod byed pa'o //
translated: the assembly of yoginis is set in motion.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i dra ba ni tshogs te ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i dra ba ni tshogs te ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis bskyod pa'o //
translated: The net of yoginis is the assembly. It is set in motion by the light rays of gnosis.

original: ta yig 'bar bar byed pa'i sngags //
analyzed: ta yig 'bar bar byed pa'i sngags //
translated: The syllable ta is the mantra of the blazing.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar pha'i yi ges gsal bar byed pa'i sngags te phat kyi yi ger 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar pha'i yi ges gsal bar byed pa'i sngags te phat kyi yi ger 'gyur ro //
translated: The syllable of the father is the mantra of the blazing. It is the syllable phat.üîΩThe mantra words of Simharukekha.

original: sim ha r'u pe kha:'i sngags kyi tshig ces bya ba ni sim ha r'u pe kha:'i sngags kyi tshig go //
analyzed: sim ha r'u pe kha:'i sngags kyi tshig ces bya ba ni sim ha r'u pe kha:'i sngags kyi tshig go //
translated: The mantra words of Simharukekha.

original: bgegs kyi gtso bo rlag byed pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba ni bgegs kyi gtso bo rnams la seng ge'i @75a * //
analyzed: bgegs kyi gtso bo rlag byed pa'o // zhes bya ba ni bgegs kyi gtso bo rnams la seng ge'i @75a * //
translated: The destroyer of the chief of obstructors.üîΩThe chief of obstructors, having seen the form of a lion,

original: gzugs bstan pas 'bros par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs bstan pas 'bros par byed do //
translated: flees.üîΩThe mantra of Gajarukega.

original: ga dza r'u pa ga:'i sngags zhes bya ba ni ga dza r'u pe ga:zhes bya ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: ga dza r'u pa ga:'i sngags zhes bya ba ni ga dza r'u pe ga:zhes bya ba'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of Gajarukega.

original: sems can kun gyi bgegs byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi bgegs byed pa'o //
translated: The obstructor of all beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdang ba'i sems can rnams dang bstan pa la gnod pa byed pa rnams la sna tshogs pa'i bgegs kyi rnam par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdang ba'i sems can rnams dang bstan pa la gnod pa byed pa rnams la sna tshogs pa'i bgegs kyi rnam par byed do //
translated: This is the various kinds of obstacles that are created for hostile sentient beings and for those who harm the doctrine.

original: tree lo kya do re'i tshig ces bya ba ni tri lo kya ngo re'i tshig go //
analyzed: tree lo kya do re'i tshig ces bya ba ni tri lo kya ngo re'i tshig go //
translated: The words of the three worlds means the words of the three worlds.

original: rab mchog pho nya kun skyed pa'o //
analyzed: rab mchog pho nya kun skyed pa'o //
translated: The best messenger is generated everywhere.

original: zhes bya ba ni rab mchog gi pho nya rnams dus 'dir skyed par byed de khams gsum du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab mchog gi pho nya rnams dus 'dir skyed par byed de khams gsum du'o //
translated: This is the generation of the best messengers at this time, in the three worlds.

original: sa mu dra me kha le gra ha gnyis kyi tshig sngags zhes bya ba ni sa mu dra me kha le gra ha'i sngags kyi tshig go //üîΩrgya mtsho lta bu'i ska rags spras //
analyzed: sa mu dra me kha le gra ha gnyis kyi tshig sngags zhes bya ba ni sa mu dra me kha le gra ha'i sngags kyi tshig go // rgya mtsho lta bu'i ska rags spras //
translated: The words of the mantra of the ocean-garland-graha are the words of the mantra of the ocean-garland-graha.

original: de ni sngags kyi ska rags so //
analyzed: de ni sngags kyi ska rags so //
translated: The ocean-garland-graha is the mantra-belt.

original: de thams cad kyi ska rags te tshad med pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi sngags so //
analyzed: de thams cad kyi ska rags te tshad med pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi sngags so //
translated: This is the belt of all of them, the mantra of immeasurable good qualities.

original: h'um dang phat kyi yi ge ni //
analyzed: h'um dang phat kyi yi ge ni //
translated: The syllables hum and phat

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi khyab bdag go //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi khyab bdag go //
translated: are the lords of the dakinis.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sngags mkha' 'gro ma'i khyab bdag ste gtso bor gyur pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sngags mkha' 'gro ma'i khyab bdag ste gtso bor gyur pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Thus, the mantra is the lord of the dakinis, the form of wisdom itself.

original: b'i r'a dree te zhes bya ba ni b'i r'a dvee te'o //
analyzed: b'i r'a dree te zhes bya ba ni b'i r'a dvee te'o //
translated: The word vaira means heroic.

original: h'um sngags tshig ces bya ba nam h'um gi yi ge'i sngags kyi tshig go //
analyzed: h'um sngags tshig ces bya ba nam h'um gi yi ge'i sngags kyi tshig go //
translated: The word hum is the mantra syllable.

original: thabs dang shes rab gnyis med las //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis med las //
translated: From the nondual union of means and wisdom

original: tha mal 'dus byas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: tha mal 'dus byas skyes pa'o //
translated: arises the ordinary compounded being.

original: zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa dang 'dus byas skyes pa thabs dang shes rab las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa dang 'dus byas skyes pa thabs dang shes rab las so //
translated: The ordinary compounded being arises from means and wisdom.

original: de de bzhin du thams cad dbyer med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ltar rkang pa bdun sngags so //
analyzed: de de bzhin du thams cad dbyer med pa'o zhes bya ba'o // de ltar rkang pa bdun sngags so //
translated: Thus, all is indivisible.üîΩ Thus, the seven-line mantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sngags kyi tshig bdun te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sngags kyi tshig bdun te /
translated: Thus, the seven mantra syllables.

original: da nyid bshad pa la /üîΩh'um phat sim ha r'u pe kha:/
analyzed: da nyid bshad pa la / h'um phat sim ha r'u pe kha:/
translated: Now, the explanation:üîΩHum phat simharupaka,

original: ga ji r'u pe ga:/
analyzed: ga ji r'u pe ga:/
translated: ga jirupe ga,

original: tree lokya do re /
analyzed: tree lokya do re /
translated: trelokyadhare,

original: sa mu da me kha le gra ha gra ha /
analyzed: sa mu da me kha le gra ha gra ha /
translated: samudrame kale graha graha,

original: h'um phat / b'i r'a dvee te h'um zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: h'um phat / b'i r'a dvee te h'um zhes bya ba'o //
translated: hum phat vaire hum.

original: las thams cad dang 'jig rten pa'i //
analyzed: las thams cad dang 'jig rten pa'i //
translated: All actions and mundane

original: yid kyi rang bzhin bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin bskyed pa'o //
translated: are generated from the nature of mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni las thams cad ni zhi ba la sogs pas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa dang yid kyi rang bzhin du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las thams cad ni zhi ba la sogs pas 'jig rten pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi sa dang yid kyi rang bzhin du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: All actions are mundane pacification, etc. , and are generated from the nature of mind, the stage of intuition.

original: yid ni rnam par shes pa dang rlung sna tshogs pa'i rtsa kun du spyod bas so //
analyzed: yid ni rnam par shes pa dang rlung sna tshogs pa'i rtsa kun du spyod bas so //
translated: Mind is the conduct of various consciousnesses and winds in the channels.

original: 'di gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: This is stated, etc.

original: sa ni rten te yid do //
analyzed: sa ni rten te yid do //
translated: The stage is the support, which is mind.

original: ye shes de'i ngo bo rang bzhin te ye shes kyi sa'o //
analyzed: ye shes de'i ngo bo rang bzhin te ye shes kyi sa'o //
translated: The nature of that intuition is the stage of intuition.

original: las grub pa'i mthar zhes bya ba ni 'di rnal 'byor pa gang dang gang gis las rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa rnams dang par byed de grub pa dang de'i @75b rang bzhin du 'gro'o //
analyzed: las grub pa'i mthar zhes bya ba ni 'di rnal 'byor pa gang dang gang gis las rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa rnams dang par byed de grub pa dang de'i @75b rang bzhin du 'gro'o //
translated: The end of the practice of action is that whatever action a yogin undertakes, such as pacification, etc. , is accomplished and becomes his nature.

original: de'i nus mthus sam sems can rnams kyi yang byed do //
analyzed: de'i nus mthus sam sems can rnams kyi yang byed do //
translated: By the power of that, he also acts for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de yang de nyid de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de yang de nyid de bzhin du'o //
translated: And that is just so.

original: 'on kyang las kyi mthar de'i go 'phang go 'phang ni gnas te mchog sna tshogs pa'i sbyor ba 'dzin pa'i lus rnams kyis lhan cig tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang las kyi mthar de'i go 'phang go 'phang ni gnas te mchog sna tshogs pa'i sbyor ba 'dzin pa'i lus rnams kyis lhan cig tu 'gro'o //
translated: But at the end of the action, he goes together with the bodies of various kinds of yogic attainments, which are the states of the goal.

original: slar yang de ltar lam la gnas pa'i mi dang / sangs rgyas rnams dang rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar yang de ltar lam la gnas pa'i mi dang / sangs rgyas rnams dang rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Again, in that way, the human who is situated on the path and the buddhas are born in the nature of Vajradhara.

original: sgyu ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of being illusion itself.

original: yang na sgyu ma'i rnam par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na sgyu ma'i rnam par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, they do not become illusory.

original: te'i yi ges sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten thams cad skye ba la sogs pa med de khams gsum bden pa ma yin pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: te'i yi ges sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten thams cad skye ba la sogs pa med de khams gsum bden pa ma yin pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: By the syllable te, all buddhas and worlds are without birth, etc., because the three realms are not real form itself.

original: mi bden pa rnams la bden par yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: mi bden pa rnams la bden par yongs su rtog go //
translated: The unreal are imagined to be real.

original: mi rtag par mi shes so //
analyzed: mi rtag par mi shes so //
translated: Impermanence is not known.

original: de'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the accumulation of merit, buddhas, etc., arise.

original: de ltar ye shes kyi tshogs su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes kyi tshogs su 'byung ngo //
translated: In that way, the accumulation of wisdom arises.

original: sgyu ma'i rnam pa nyid sgyu ma chen po'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rnam pa nyid sgyu ma chen po'o //
translated: The forms of illusion are the Great Illusion.

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúnot illusion‚Äù and so forth is this.

original: bdag nyid mngon par so sor rtog ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyang chos nyid ston pa'i phyir de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon par so sor rtog ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyang chos nyid ston pa'i phyir de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äú One‚Äôs own nature is fully understood‚Äù means that the Dharma of all the Buddhas is taught as the nature of reality.

original: de ci'i phyir te bshad pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir te bshad pa /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir rdo rje phag mo'i tshig ste yang dag pa'i snying rje'i'o //
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje phag mo'i tshig ste yang dag pa'i snying rje'i'o //
translated: Here is the statement of VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, the true compassion:

original: bdag nyid ni mi bden pa med pa ste gang gis bcings pa'am grol ba'am des na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du bdag nyid la sogs pas thams cad rtog par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni mi bden pa med pa ste gang gis bcings pa'am grol ba'am des na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du bdag nyid la sogs pas thams cad rtog par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own nature is unreal, non-existent, by which one is bound or liberated.‚Äù Therefore, by one‚Äôs own nature and so forth, everything is imagined as mere worldly convention.

original: des na bcing ba dang grol ba med de sgyu ma dang sgyu ma lta bu rnams kyis rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na bcing ba dang grol ba med de sgyu ma dang sgyu ma lta bu rnams kyis rmongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is neither bondage nor liberation. One is deluded by illusions and those like illusions.

original: 'khor bar 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor ro //
translated: One wanders in cyclic existence.

original: 'byung ba med pa yongs su brtags pa yis so //
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa yongs su brtags pa yis so //
translated: One is imagined to be without an origin.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i dngos pos dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i dngos pos dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ngo //
translated: I experience the suffering of hell and so on due to the entities of self and mine.

original: de'i phyir mi bden pa gang du yang mi gnas pa ste lus thams cad kyang rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis sems dang sems las 'byung ba skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi bden pa gang du yang mi gnas pa ste lus thams cad kyang rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i dbang gis sems dang sems las 'byung ba skye'o //
translated: Therefore, since it does not exist anywhere as real, the entire body arises from the mind and mental factors due to the power of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: khams sna tshogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs pa yang ngo //
translated: [It arises] from the various elements.

original: mdor na rang gi bdag nyid so sor rtog pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na rang gi bdag nyid so sor rtog pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In brief, it is said to arise from the individual discernment of one's own nature.

original: 'on kyang chos thams cad dang theg pa gsum la sogs pa so sor rtog pa tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos thams cad dang theg pa gsum la sogs pa so sor rtog pa tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, it is said to be the mere discernment of all phenomena, the three vehicles, and so on.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i tshig snying rje rdo rje phag mo'i'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i tshig snying rje rdo rje phag mo'i'o //
translated: The words of non-error are those of Vajravarahi.

original: 'di ni 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul 'khor gyi 'khor lo bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: This is the eleventh wheel of the yantra.

original: da ni bcu gnyis pa brjod par bya ste /üîΩh'um zhes bya ba la @76a * //
analyzed: da ni bcu gnyis pa brjod par bya ste / h'um zhes bya ba la @76a * //
translated: Now, the twelfth [wheel] should be stated.

original: sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ste /
translated: Hum and so on.

original: h'um gi yi ge'o //
analyzed: h'um gi yi ge'o //
translated: The syllable hum.

original: h'a gnyis zhes bya ba ni h'a'i yi ge gnyis te h'a h'a'o //
analyzed: h'a gnyis zhes bya ba ni h'a'i yi ge gnyis te h'a h'a'o //
translated: Two has means two ha syllables, ha ha.

original: ma h'a pa shu ma h'a ni zhes bya ba ni ma h'a pa shu mo ha ni tshig go //
analyzed: ma h'a pa shu ma h'a ni zhes bya ba ni ma h'a pa shu mo ha ni tshig go //
translated: MahƒÅpa≈õu mahƒÅni means MahƒÅpa≈õu mohani.

original: 'khor ba rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar tshig de 'khor ba'i rmongs pa ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ngan 'gro rnam par 'joms pa'o //üîΩyo gi shva ri tvam gyi sngags //
analyzed: 'khor ba rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar tshig de 'khor ba'i rmongs pa ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ngan 'gro rnam par 'joms pa'o // yo gi shva ri tvam gyi sngags //
translated: SamsƒÅra moha means thus, that word is the delusion of samsƒÅra, the destroyer of bad rebirths for yogins.üîΩThe mantra of Yogƒ´≈õvarƒ´

original: zhes bya ba ni yo gi shva ri tvam gyi sngags so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yo gi shva ri tvam gyi sngags so //
translated: means the mantra of Yogƒ´≈õvarƒ´.

original: zhi ba yi ni gzugs su'o //
analyzed: zhi ba yi ni gzugs su'o //
translated: In the form of ≈öƒÅnti

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i gzugs can ma'i sngags te nus mthu sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyang 'dzin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i gzugs can ma'i sngags te nus mthu sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyang 'dzin no //
translated: means the mantra of ≈öƒÅnti-r≈´pi·πáƒ´, who also assumes various powerful forms.üîΩThe words of ·∏åƒÅkinƒ´ lokanƒÅtha-bandhani

original: t'a ki ni lo k'a n'i bandha ni'i tshig ces bya ba ni d'a ki ni lo k'a n'am bandha ni'i sngags kyi tshig go //üîΩ'jig rten byang chub tu 'jug byed //
analyzed: t'a ki ni lo k'a n'i bandha ni'i tshig ces bya ba ni d'a ki ni lo k'a n'am bandha ni'i sngags kyi tshig go // 'jig rten byang chub tu 'jug byed //
translated: means the mantra words of ·∏åƒÅkinƒ´ lokanƒÅtha-bandhani.üîΩEngaging the world in enlightenment

original: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten rnams byang chub la 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten rnams byang chub la 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: means engaging the world in enlightenment.

original: sa t+ya me h'um phat kyi sngags kyi tshig ces bya ba ni sat+ya me h'um phat kyi sngags kyi tshig go //
analyzed: sa t+ya me h'um phat kyi sngags kyi tshig ces bya ba ni sat+ya me h'um phat kyi sngags kyi tshig go //
translated: The words of the mantra satya me hum phat are the words of the mantra satya me hum phat.

original: mtha' bzhi po ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi po ni ston pa'o //
translated: It teaches the four extremes.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngags 'di'i bden pas mtha' bzhi'i chos kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngags 'di'i bden pas mtha' bzhi'i chos kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the truth of this mantra, the four extremes are also taught.

original: bh'u ta tr'a sa ni yi tshig / mu stegs ye shes 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: bh'u ta tr'a sa ni yi tshig / mu stegs ye shes 'joms pa'o //
translated: The words bhuta trasani are the destroyer of the wisdom of the tirthikas.

original: zhes bya ba ni mu stegs kyi ye shes te ka ba li la sogs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa 'joms pa ste chos bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mu stegs kyi ye shes te ka ba li la sogs pa rnams kyi dgongs pa 'joms pa ste chos bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of the tirthikas is the intention of the Kabaliri and so forth, which is destroyed by the teaching of the Dharma and so forth.

original: de ltar sngags tshig bdun pos ni //
analyzed: de ltar sngags tshig bdun pos ni //
translated: Thus, with seven mantra words,

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sngags kyi rkang pa bdun te bshad pa h'um h'um h'a h'a /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sngags kyi rkang pa bdun te bshad pa h'um h'um h'a h'a /

original: gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang gis 'khor lo la lhag par gnas pa'i rang bzhin chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis @86a * //

original: rigs kyi bye brag bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang dmangs rigs la sogs pa la yongs su brten nas gsal bar mthong ba zhes bya bar 'brel lo //

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i sbyor ba skyes gnas zhes bya ba ste 'di'i sbyor bas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi nang gi bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid kyis chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa la sogs pa ste /

translated: Therefore, the ‚Äúbirth‚Äù of the desire yoga is the state of the yogis‚Äô inner nature, characterized by the dharmakƒÅya, sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya, and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i ngas pa mchog gi mtshon bya rnams su thig le bzhi dang bral bas rtsen pa rdo rje 'chang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i ngas pa mchog gi mtshon bya rnams su thig le bzhi dang bral bas rtsen pa rdo rje 'chang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is that the yogis play with the four bindus in the supreme objects of desire, the state of Vajradhara.

original: 'di ni mchog gi mtshon bya rnams la thig le bzhi dang bral bas rol pa rdo rje 'chang gi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni mchog gi mtshon bya rnams la thig le bzhi dang bral bas rol pa rdo rje 'chang gi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: This is the state of Vajradhara, the play with the four bindus in the supreme objects of desire.

original: de'i tshe 'o na mngal gyi gnas skabs la sogs pa thams cad dang 'jig rten pa'i bya ba dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang 'jig rten gyi khams la sogs pa brdzun du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'o na mngal gyi gnas skabs la sogs pa thams cad dang 'jig rten pa'i bya ba dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang 'jig rten gyi khams la sogs pa brdzun du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: At that time, if it is asked, ‚ÄúWouldn‚Äôt all the states of the womb and so on, worldly activities, buddhafields, worlds, and so on, be false?‚Äù

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is that?‚Äù

original: dga' ba dang mchog dang bral ba dang lhan skyes kyi gnas skabs kyi sems can thams cad kyi dang brtan pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog dang bral ba dang lhan skyes kyi gnas skabs kyi sems can thams cad kyi dang brtan pa dang 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The state of all sentient beings, such as the state of joy, supreme joy, separation from joy, and innate joy, and the state of going and so forth, arise.

original: de'i tshe dngos po med pa las dngos por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po med pa las dngos por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: At that time, if it is asked, ‚ÄúHow does a thing arise from a non-thing?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sems can dngos po med pas sems can gyi don de ji ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can dngos po med pas sems can gyi don de ji ltar /
translated: Therefore, since sentient beings are non-existent, how is the benefit of sentient beings?

original: rol ba mchog gi mtshon phyir rdo rje 'chang gi skus gnas grong med par gang du mtha' dang mtha' las zhes so //
analyzed: rol ba mchog gi mtshon phyir rdo rje 'chang gi skus gnas grong med par gang du mtha' dang mtha' las zhes so //
translated: In order to illustrate the supreme play, the body of Vajradhara abides in a place without a town, where the end and beyond the end are.

original: 'di'i the tshom la bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i tshig gis gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i the tshom la bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i tshig gis gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Here, the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs statement that ‚Äúthere is no doubt‚Äù is clarified by the following verse.

original: bza' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas te bza' ba ni bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: bza' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas te bza' ba ni bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'ching ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEating‚Äù and so on. Eating and not eating are the bonds of yogis through eating and drinking and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis 'khor ba pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa spel bas dmyal ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams kyis 'khor ba pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa spel bas dmyal ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Because they increase the passion, etc. of the transmigrators, they are the cause of hell.

original: gzhan yang skye ba la sogs pa 'gro ba sna tshogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba la sogs pa 'gro ba sna tshogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ngo //
translated: Moreover, they experience the suffering of the various destinies, such as birth.

original: tha mal pa'i bag chags kyi bud med dang skyes bu kun du sbyor ba las dga' ba la sogs par nub par byed do //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i bag chags kyi bud med dang skyes bu kun du sbyor ba las dga' ba la sogs par nub par byed do //
translated: From the union of the man and woman of ordinary instinct, the pleasure, etc. is extinguished.

original: mang po bshad pas ci bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi rdzas 'phrog pa la sogs par skyon thams cad rab tu 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: mang po bshad pas ci bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi rdzas 'phrog pa la sogs par skyon thams cad rab tu 'jug par byed do //
translated: What is the use of explaining much? All the faults, such as stealing the property of others, food and drink, etc. are set in motion.

original: 'du 'dra ba gzhan gyi dgos pa byed pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams @86b la gos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du 'dra ba gzhan gyi dgos pa byed pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams @86b la gos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are not defiled by the performance of the duties of others, who are like themselves.

original: gang gis kla klo'i chos la 'jug par byed /
analyzed: gang gis kla klo'i chos la 'jug par byed /
translated: By what are they caused to enter the barbarian dharma?

original: de ji ltar /
analyzed: de ji ltar /
translated: How is that?

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How are those Buddhas and Bodhisattvas born?

original: bshad pa / de rnams su skye ba ni sems can rnams kyi don du thabs tsam gyi skye ba yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: bshad pa / de rnams su skye ba ni sems can rnams kyi don du thabs tsam gyi skye ba yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Birth in those is the taking of birth by mere method for the sake of sentient beings.

original: des skyon med do //
analyzed: des skyon med do //
translated: By that, there is no fault.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang dang gang gi las drag pos //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi las drag pos //
translated: By whatever karma

original: 'gro ba rnams ni 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams ni 'ching ba'o //
translated: beings are bound,

original: de bzhin du ni de thabs kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni de thabs kyis //
translated: by that very method

original: srid pa'i 'ching ba las 'grol lo //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'ching ba las 'grol lo //
translated: they are freed from the bondage of existence.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir de rnams 'dod chags la sogs pas mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir de rnams 'dod chags la sogs pas mi 'dzin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not bound by desire and so on.

original: 'on kyang sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku can rnams kyi thig le bzhi rnams kyi byang chub pa yang gsungs te thabs kyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku can rnams kyi thig le bzhi rnams kyi byang chub pa yang gsungs te thabs kyis so //
translated: However, it is said that all sentient beings are enlightened by the four bindus of the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya buddhas by means of method.

original: de mi shes pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i bag chags rnams kyis rmongs pa ni 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mi shes pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i bag chags rnams kyis rmongs pa ni 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not know that are bound by the traces of samsara.

original: de rnams gdon pa'i phyir des de lta bu'i rgyus gnas pa ste mchog tu mtshon par bya ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams gdon pa'i phyir des de lta bu'i rgyus gnas pa ste mchog tu mtshon par bya ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: In order to remove those, by that cause, he abides, that is, he is the nature of Great Vajradhara, the supreme object of attainment.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And so it is said:

original: gang gis de ltar rmongs pa 'ching //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar rmongs pa 'ching //
translated: By whom, thus deluded, is bound,

original: blo dang ldan pas rtsen par byed //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas rtsen par byed //
translated: the wise one plays.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: And so on, with those words.

original: de'i phyir thig le bzhi dang bral ba rang gi bag chags kyi skyon dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir thig le bzhi dang bral ba rang gi bag chags kyi skyon dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, free from the four bindus, free from the fault of one's own traces, is the meaning of the statement.üîΩHow, again, are those engaged in eating, drinking, and so on?

original: ji ltar slar yang de rnams kyi bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa 'jug / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slar yang de rnams kyi bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa 'jug / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de rnams su ni bza' ston mo //
analyzed: de rnams su ni bza' ston mo //
translated: In those, the feast of eating,

original: phyugs chen ye shes kyi gzugs can //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyugs chen ye shes kyi gzugs can // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the great animal, the form of wisdom.

original: 'dir phyugs chen po ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir phyugs chen po ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: Here, the great animal is samsara.

original: thig le bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thig le bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four bindus, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi bza' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi bza' ba ste /
translated: The food of those buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: ts'a ru ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba za ba'o //
analyzed: ts'a ru ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba za ba'o //
translated: Caru is the eating of the moving and unmoving.

original: gang gi phyir kun rdzob kyi ye shes don dam pa'i chos thams cad yongs su shes pa mchog tu gnyis su med pa bstan pa tsam nyid de'i gzugs can ma lus pa'i phyir phyugs chen po'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun rdzob kyi ye shes don dam pa'i chos thams cad yongs su shes pa mchog tu gnyis su med pa bstan pa tsam nyid de'i gzugs can ma lus pa'i phyir phyugs chen po'o //
translated: Because the knowledge of the conventional is the supreme understanding of all ultimate phenomena, it is the mere teaching of nonduality. Since it is the form of all, it is the great animal.

original: tha mal pa rnams kyis 'di 'dra ba'i las de mi za ba'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa rnams kyis 'di 'dra ba'i las de mi za ba'o //
translated: Ordinary people do not eat such an action.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams kyis bzhag pa de bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams kyis bzhag pa de bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas and lords of yoga should eat it.

original: mngon sum du aa wa dh'u t'ir zhugs pa na thams cad mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid med par bya'o //üîΩgal te mi rtag pa mtshan nyid med pa'i chos de gang las ji tsam thams cad ji ltar @87a * //
analyzed: mngon sum du aa wa dh'u t'ir zhugs pa na thams cad mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid med par bya'o // gal te mi rtag pa mtshan nyid med pa'i chos de gang las ji tsam thams cad ji ltar @87a * //
translated: When it is directly placed in the avadh≈´ti, all should be made to lack the character of impermanence.

original: sems can gyi don du mtshon par bya zhe na /üîΩgsungs pa / mtshon min gsal bar mtshon bya ste //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du mtshon par bya zhe na / gsungs pa / mtshon min gsal bar mtshon bya ste //
translated: If that phenomenon of the character of impermanence is from what and how much, how is it illustrated for the benefit of sentient beings?üîΩIt is said:

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe unillustrated should be illustrated clearly.‚Äù

original: 'dir gang gi tshe nang gi bdag nyid can rang gi bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba'i rkyen gyi ye shes mtshan nyid med pa brjod du med pa bden pa ma yin pa mi rtag pa gzhom du med pa gzugs med pa /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe nang gi bdag nyid can rang gi bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba'i rkyen gyi ye shes mtshan nyid med pa brjod du med pa bden pa ma yin pa mi rtag pa gzhom du med pa gzugs med pa /
translated: Here, when the inner nature of one‚Äôs own nature is the wisdom of the condition of engagement, it is signless, inexpressible, not true, impermanent, invincible, formless,üîΩwithout beginning, without end, without middle, without body, without speech, without mind, not wisdom, and so on.

original: thog ma med pa tha ma med pa dbus ma yin pa lus med pa ngag med pa sems med pa ye shes ma yin pa kun zhes pa la sogs pas gang mtshon pa rang gi rig pa sna tshogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa tha ma med pa dbus ma yin pa lus med pa ngag med pa sems med pa ye shes ma yin pa kun zhes pa la sogs pas gang mtshon pa rang gi rig pa sna tshogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That which is illustrated by all is the nature of the substance of one‚Äôs awareness.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad dang / brtan pa la sogs g-yo ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig rten pa yang ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad dang / brtan pa la sogs g-yo ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig rten pa yang ni //
translated: Therefore, all migrating beings, the moving such as the earth, and the world,

original: kun gyis mi mtshon mtshon par bya //
analyzed: kun gyis mi mtshon mtshon par bya //
translated: are not illustrated by all.

original: zhes so // de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: Thus, they are also mundane and supramundane.

original: sems can thams cad kyis mtshon pa med pa nyid du yang mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mtshon pa med pa nyid du yang mtshon par bya'o //
translated: All sentient beings are not illustrated, and yet they are illustrated.

original: de lta bu'i gzugs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams kyis kyang ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'i dus su yang mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug rnams kyis kyang ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'i dus su yang mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Even those lords of yoga who have such a form should be illustrated when they arise from samƒÅdhi.

original: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyis sems can de rnams la chos ston pa lung sna tshogs pa rnams brjod pa'i tshig bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyis sems can de rnams la chos ston pa lung sna tshogs pa rnams brjod pa'i tshig bstan par bya'o //
translated: The word clearly should be applied to the teaching of the Dharma to those sentient beings by the nature of that [form], and to the expression of various scriptures.

original: de'i phyir sems can gyi don grub ste sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gyi don grub ste sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis so //
translated: Therefore, the benefit of sentient beings is accomplished by the power of previous aspirations.

original: de ji ltar mchog tu mtshon par bya ba la gnas /üîΩgsungs pa / mtshon bya mtshon pa rab spong ba //
analyzed: de ji ltar mchog tu mtshon par bya ba la gnas / gsungs pa / mtshon bya mtshon pa rab spong ba //
translated: How does that abide in supreme illustration?

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said:üîΩAbandoning the illustrated and the illustration.

original: mtshon bya ni sems can la sogs pa'i khams so //
analyzed: mtshon bya ni sems can la sogs pa'i khams so //
translated: The illustrated is the realm of sentient beings, etc.

translated: This is: O ≈örƒ´ Hevajra, we who are in the east and south quarters, together with the yoginƒ´s, are aroused from the meditative concentration on emptiness by the great bliss.

original: 'di'i don du yang /
analyzed: 'di'i don du yang /

analyzed: 'jig rten pha las khyod kyis snying rje bsgoms //
translated: You should cultivate compassion for the world more than for your father.

original: zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten pa mgon med pa rnams la khyod kyis te de bzhin du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten pa mgon med pa rnams la khyod kyis te de bzhin du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The world is without a protector, you should cultivate compassion for it, as it is said.

original: gang gis snying rje bsgoms pas ji ltar @89a * //
analyzed: gang gis snying rje bsgoms pas ji ltar @89a * //
translated: By whom is compassion cultivated, and how?

original: lha dang lha min thams cad sangs rgyas mdzod //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: lha dang lha min thams cad sangs rgyas mdzod // ces bya ba ste /
translated: You are the treasure of all gods and demigods.

original: gcig tu na khyod nyid kyis de ltar gcig sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu na khyod nyid kyis de ltar gcig sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: In one way, you yourself should not make just one person a Buddha.

original: lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa thams cad snying rjes gdul bar bya ba rnams kyang sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa thams cad snying rjes gdul bar bya ba rnams kyang sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar ro //
translated: All those to be tamed by compassion, such as gods and demigods, should become Buddhas.

original: de bzhin du yang byang phyogs dang dbang ldan na gnas pa rnams byams pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang byang phyogs dang dbang ldan na gnas pa rnams byams pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, those abiding in the north and northeast are addressed with loving-kindness:

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa bde chen byang chub kyis mnyes mdzod //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa bde chen byang chub kyis mnyes mdzod // ces bya ba ste /
translated: O Vajra Holder, delight in the enlightenment of great bliss!

original: kye bdag po rdo rje 'chang bdag cag byams pa'i bdag nyid can rnams la bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyis mnyes par mdzod cig gang gis sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar mthun par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'di yis so //
analyzed: kye bdag po rdo rje 'chang bdag cag byams pa'i bdag nyid can rnams la bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyis mnyes par mdzod cig gang gis sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar mthun par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'di yis so //
translated: O Lord Vajradhara, delight us who are of the nature of loving-kindness with the enlightenment of the nature of great bliss! By this, which is the wish for all sentient beings to be in harmony like one's only child.

original: khyod ni ci'i phyir stong nyid ting 'dzin bzhugs //
analyzed: khyod ni ci'i phyir stong nyid ting 'dzin bzhugs //
translated: Why do you dwell in the concentration of emptiness?

original: zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir mgon po khyod stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dngos po la gnas par khyod kyis dor cig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir mgon po khyod stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dngos po la gnas par khyod kyis dor cig pa'o //
translated: This means: ‚ÄúWhy, Lord, do you remain in the entity of the concentration of emptiness? You should give it up!‚Äù

original: 'di mdzod cig pa ste gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di mdzod cig pa ste gsungs pa /
translated: This is the treasure, which is stated:

original: rdo rje padma'i sbyor bas rnal 'byor ma rol sad par mdzod //
analyzed: rdo rje padma'i sbyor bas rnal 'byor ma rol sad par mdzod //
translated: By the union of vajra and lotus, awaken the yoginis!

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This means:

original: rdo rje dang padma kun du sbyor bas rnal 'byor ma rnams dga' bar mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma kun du sbyor bas rnal 'byor ma rnams dga' bar mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: By the union of vajra and lotus, delight the yoginis!

original: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams rab tu sad par 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: gang gis rnal 'byor ma rnams rab tu sad par 'gyur bar ro //
translated: By what do the yoginis awaken?

original: byas pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa /üîΩgang gis lhan cig stong nyid ting 'dzin la khyod bzhugs //
analyzed: byas pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa / gang gis lhan cig stong nyid ting 'dzin la khyod bzhugs //
translated: The result of the action is stated:üîΩBy which you dwell in the concentration of emptiness together with them.

original: zhes bya ba ste gang gis lhan cig dngos kyis khyad par du bsams pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin 'di la khyod kyis zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gang gis lhan cig dngos kyis khyad par du bsams pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin 'di la khyod kyis zhugs pa'o //
translated: This means: By which you enter this concentration of emptiness, which is imagined as having the distinction of being together with them.

original: de bzhin du nub dang rlung du rnam par gnas pa rnams kyis rab tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du nub dang rlung du rnam par gnas pa rnams kyis rab tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid can rnams kyi dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, those abiding in the west and the north, with the nature of the Joyful, are said to have the nature of joy.

original: mnga' bdag khyod kyis khams bzhi'i sa bon 'dzag par mdzod //üîΩces bya ste //
analyzed: mnga' bdag khyod kyis khams bzhi'i sa bon 'dzag par mdzod // ces bya ste //
translated: O Lord, let the seed of the four elements fall!

original: khams bzhi ni sa ngang chu dang me dang rlung ste de rnams kyi sa bon byang chub sems de khyod kyis 'dzag par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: khams bzhi ni sa ngang chu dang me dang rlung ste de rnams kyi sa bon byang chub sems de khyod kyis 'dzag par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: The four elements are earth, water, fire, and wind. Let the seed of those, the bodhicitta, fall.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir gsungs pa /üîΩaa wa dh'u t'i'i rang bzhin gtum mo ldang // zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir gsungs pa / aa wa dh'u t'i'i rang bzhin gtum mo ldang // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For what reason is it said?üîΩThe fierce fire that has the nature of the avadh≈´ti arises.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i'i rang bzhin gyis gtum mo nye bar spong pa zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i'i rang bzhin gyis gtum mo nye bar spong pa zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The fierce fire that has the nature of the avadh≈´ti is abandoned.

original: dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'pho ba med pa'i bde bas rnal 'byor ma rnams yongs su dga' bar @89b mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'pho ba med pa'i bde bas rnal 'byor ma rnams yongs su dga' bar @89b mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: The yoginƒ´s are delighted by the bliss that does not fall through the union of the two organs.

original: de bzhin du gang gis gtum mo langs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gis gtum mo langs pa /
translated: Likewise, by whom is the fierce fire arisen?

original: sa gsum sreg par byed de gang du yang ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sa gsum sreg par byed de gang du yang ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It burns the three worlds, but is not seen anywhere.

original: sa gsum ni lus dang ngag dang sems so //
analyzed: sa gsum ni lus dang ngag dang sems so //
translated: The three worlds are body, speech, and mind.

original: bsregs pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med par ston pa ste /
analyzed: bsregs pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa rang bzhin med par ston pa ste /
translated: Burning is the teaching of the unreality of the obscurations of the knowable, etc.

original: de ltar song bas gang du yang bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar song bas gang du yang bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po mi mthong ba'o //
translated: Since it goes in that way, it is not seen anywhere as the nature of self and what belongs to self, etc., or as the nature of grasped and grasper.

original: thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Everything goes to the pointlessness of that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa //
translated: Here it is said:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo 'bar zhing 'bar ba'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo 'bar zhing 'bar ba'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of nirvana is burning and blazing.üîΩThus, by the yoga of constant practice of the candali explained previously, the one who abides in the stage of joy, having been burned, becomes the nature of nirvana, which is everywhere present.

original: de ltar sngon du bshad pa'i gtum mo rtag tu rnal 'byor la goms pas rab tu dga' ba la gnas pas bsregs par gyur pas thams cad du gnas pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bar sems can gyi don du kye khyab bdag mdzod cig
analyzed: de ltar sngon du bshad pa'i gtum mo rtag tu rnal 'byor la goms pas rab tu dga' ba la gnas pas bsregs par gyur pas thams cad du gnas pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bar sems can gyi don du kye khyab bdag mdzod cig
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, O Lord of the Universe, please do it!

original: pa'o // de bzhin du lho dang bden bral du gnas pa rnams kyis btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: pa'o // de bzhin du lho dang bden bral du gnas pa rnams kyis btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin gyis gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, those who abide in the south and in the southwest are said to be of the nature of equanimity.

original: lhan skyes rang bzhin gyis ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams dga' bar mdzod //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhan skyes rang bzhin gyis ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams dga' bar mdzod // ces bya ba ste /
translated: The dakinis are delighted by the innate nature.

original: kye mgon po bdag cag mkha' 'gro ma rnams btang snyoms te stong pa nyid spong ba'i rgyu rnams la lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyis dga' ba bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin rang nyid mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: kye mgon po bdag cag mkha' 'gro ma rnams btang snyoms te stong pa nyid spong ba'i rgyu rnams la lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyis dga' ba bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin rang nyid mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: O protector, we dakinis are equanimous, that is, we are of the nature of great bliss, which is the innate nature that delights in the causes of abandoning emptiness.

original: gang gis skye ba dang ni 'chi ba so sor ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gcig tu na stong pa nyid kyi 'chi ba lta bur mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis skye ba dang ni 'chi ba so sor ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gcig tu na stong pa nyid kyi 'chi ba lta bur mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: By whom birth and death are not seen individually, that is, in one way, emptiness is not seen as like death.

original: shi ba las sngar yang skye'o //
analyzed: shi ba las sngar yang skye'o //
translated: Before death, one is born.

original: de'i phyir bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyang gsungs pa /üîΩrgyal ba mgon pos sems can sad par mdzod //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyang gsungs pa / rgyal ba mgon pos sems can sad par mdzod //
translated: Therefore, enlightenment, which is of the nature of great bliss, is also said.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: The Victorious Protector should awaken the sentient beings.

original: mdor na kye rgyal ba mgon po bde ba chen po 'di'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi mdzes pa'i sems su mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na kye rgyal ba mgon po bde ba chen po 'di'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi mdzes pa'i sems su mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: In brief, O Victorious One, the Protector, the Great Bliss, you should be the mind of enlightenment, which is the nature of this [universe].

original: gang gis de ltar bsgrubs pas 'dir 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar bsgrubs pas 'dir 'gyur bar gsungs pa /
translated: By whom it is accomplished in this way, it is said:

original: sgyu ma'i sems can khams ni bsgral bar mdzod //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i sems can khams ni bsgral bar mdzod //
translated: You should liberate the realm of illusory sentient beings.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ltar yang bde ba chen po'i ngo bo'i byang chub sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyis sems can gyi khams sgrol cig pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang bde ba chen po'i ngo bo'i byang chub sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyis sems can gyi khams sgrol cig pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of Great Bliss, the enlightenment, which is of the nature of illusion, should liberate the realm of sentient beings.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni de ltar thos nas rtogs pa'i glu chen po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni de ltar thos nas rtogs pa'i glu chen po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is, having heard in this way, the great song of realization, which is called great.

original: ngag rnams shin tu 'dzin pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: ngag rnams shin tu 'dzin pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: It is by the nature of the retention of speech.

original: glu 'di'i nye bar spyad pas gzhan par bstan pa'i rnal 'byor ma @90a * //
analyzed: glu 'di'i nye bar spyad pas gzhan par bstan pa'i rnal 'byor ma @90a * //
translated: By the practice of this song, the yoginis who are taught elsewhere,

original: rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis de'i rang bzhin du phyis 'dres pa'i dngos pos rab tu sad do //
analyzed: rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis de'i rang bzhin du phyis 'dres pa'i dngos pos rab tu sad do //
translated: by the nature of their own nature, later awaken by the power of mixing with that nature.

original: ji ltar chu la thim pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chu la thim pa'o //
translated: Just as [they] dissolve into the water.

original: de yang rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i gtso mo'i rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas te sogs pa'i sgras chos dang chos nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yang rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i gtso mo'i rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas te sogs pa'i sgras chos dang chos nyid kyang ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is like an illusion, etc., with the nature of the chief of the yoginis' wheel, etc.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i gtso mo sgyu ma lta bu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i gtso mo sgyu ma lta bu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The chief of the wheel, etc., is characterized as like an illusion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsungs pa / mthong bar gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas te rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sku chen po'i snang brnyan gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsungs pa / mthong bar gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas te rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi ngo bo'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sku chen po'i snang brnyan gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is said, when one sees, etc., the reflection of the great body of clear light, with the nature of the essence of all yoginis.

original: de yang mtshan nyid ma thim pa ste lnga pa'i don gyi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid ma thim pa ste lnga pa'i don gyi gnyis pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is dissolved into the characteristic, the second of the five meanings.

original: der thim pa'i nam mkha' las rang gi 'khor lo ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gzugs thim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der thim pa'i nam mkha' las rang gi 'khor lo ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gzugs thim par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, one's own wheel dissolves into space, form dissolves into form.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i gzugs me long la sogs pas so sor gsal te me long gi dngos po de la de bzhin du yongs su gyur nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i gzugs me long la sogs pas so sor gsal te me long gi dngos po de la de bzhin du yongs su gyur nas 'gro'o //
translated: Just as an illusory form is reflected in a mirror, etc., and goes there, having completely transformed into that entity of the mirror.

original: de ltar rgyu ma lta bu mthong bar gyur pas thim pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu ma lta bu mthong bar gyur pas thim pa'o //
translated: Thus, having seen the form like an illusion, it dissolves.

original: slar yang rigs pa 'dis bar skabs kyi sku bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang rigs pa 'dis bar skabs kyi sku bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Again, by this reasoning, he teaches the arrangement of the four bodies in the interval.

original: gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The second, etc.,

original: sogs kyis sgras longs rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs kyis sgras longs rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the Complete Enjoyment.üîΩAnd those also,

original: de dag kyang / de dag kyang nam mkha' la sku so sor gsal te lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang / de dag kyang nam mkha' la sku so sor gsal te lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'o //
translated: those also are reflected in space as individual bodies, the Innate Body.

original: slar yang de la de ltar thim ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang de la de ltar thim ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Again, having seen that, it dissolves into that, the Complete Enjoyment.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i bdag nyid du sprul pa mo chos kyi sku yang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo'i bdag nyid du sprul pa mo chos kyi sku yang ngo //
translated: The Emanation, in the nature of the Yoginƒ´‚Äôs Wheel, is also the Truth Body.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni sku gsum gcig tu rjes su bsgrubs pa las sgrib pa med par spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid snang ba med pa dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni sku gsum gcig tu rjes su bsgrubs pa las sgrib pa med par spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid snang ba med pa dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: All means that, having been established as the one of the three bodies, it is the nature of the non-obstructed, non-elaborated intuition, the nature of the non-appearing primordial Buddha.

original: bshad pa'i lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa dang bral ba de'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas kyi yul ye shes kyi tshig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bshad pa'i lhan cig skyes pa la sogs pa bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa dang bral ba de'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas kyi yul ye shes kyi tshig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the words the domain of the Buddha, intuition is that it is free from the fourfold arrangement of the innate, etc., as explained above, and is of their nature.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rigs pas bsgom pa byas pas so //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rigs pas bsgom pa byas pas so //
translated: Having thus accomplished the Yoginƒ´ Tantras, by means of the reasoning of the Yoginƒ´ Tantras, one should meditate.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams su sems 'od gsal du son pas de kho na nyid rang gi rig pa gnyis su med pa'i yid ches pas rang gis mngon sum du nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor gyi rgyud rnams su sems 'od gsal du son pas de kho na nyid rang gi rig pa gnyis su med pa'i yid ches pas rang gis mngon sum du nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in the Yoga Tantras, by the mind having reached the state of clear light, one should have confidence in the non-dual intuition of reality, and experience it for oneself.

original: gal te sems de srid du 'od gsal bar son pa de'i tshe de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi @90b rgyud rnams su gang gis yid ches par 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te sems de srid du 'od gsal bar son pa de'i tshe de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi @90b rgyud rnams su gang gis yid ches par 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: If the mind has reached such luminosity, then one should rely on the statements in the Yoga Tantra, such as the Heruka Galpo, that inspire confidence.

original: slob dpon gyi ni sems rdo rje //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi ni sems rdo rje //
translated: The master's mind is vajra.

original: zhes bya ba ste 'dir mkhas pa rnams kyi thog mar tsa'i yi ges bye brag smra ba dang mdo sde ba'i tshul la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste 'dir mkhas pa rnams kyi thog mar tsa'i yi ges bye brag smra ba dang mdo sde ba'i tshul la brten par bya'o //
translated: Here, the wise should first rely on the CƒÅrvƒÅka and SautrƒÅntika systems.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: gsungs pa / 'dir lus la 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i khams rnams chos mngon pa'i rigs pas dang bye brag smra ba'i chos kyis rnal 'byor pa des mi rtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'dir lus la 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa'i khams rnams chos mngon pa'i rigs pas dang bye brag smra ba'i chos kyis rnal 'byor pa des mi rtag par bya'o //
translated: It is said: Here, the yogƒ´ should make the elements such as earth in the body impermanent by means of the reasoning of Abhidharma and the Dharma of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: des slar yang mdo sde pa rnams dang bcas pa'i lta ba la sems brtan pa skyed par byed de sna tshogs pa'i skyes rabs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des slar yang mdo sde pa rnams dang bcas pa'i lta ba la sems brtan pa skyed par byed de sna tshogs pa'i skyes rabs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, he should generate a stable mind in the views of the SautrƒÅntikas and so on, such as the JƒÅtakamƒÅlƒÅ.

original: de ltar yang mi bden par byas nas sems nam mkha'i ngo bo can du rnal 'byor spyod par 'gyur ba ma rig pa yongs su spong pa las sems rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang mi bden par byas nas sems nam mkha'i ngo bo can du rnal 'byor spyod par 'gyur ba ma rig pa yongs su spong pa las sems rdo rje'o //
translated: Thus, having made it unreal, the yogi/nƒ´ should practice with the mind having the nature of space.

original: dbu ma ni rtsa ba ste de ltar sbyong yul ni dngos po thams cad do //
analyzed: dbu ma ni rtsa ba ste de ltar sbyong yul ni dngos po thams cad do //
translated: The central channel is the root. Thus, the object of purification is all things.

original: de rnams kyi spyod pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su shes pa dang rig pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi spyod pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su shes pa dang rig pa'o //
translated: Since they are the conduct of those, they are thoroughly known and realized.

original: de ltar sems kyi rdo rje'i chos thams cad slob dpon gyis de'i tshe khyad par nyid kyis de'i nang du chos thams cad son pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi rdo rje'i chos thams cad slob dpon gyis de'i tshe khyad par nyid kyis de'i nang du chos thams cad son pa'o /

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis lus kyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa rig pa po kun rdzob kyi 'od gsal bar song ba yang sgyu ma'i rnam pas sems rdo rje so sor snang ba'i sku'i rnam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis lus kyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa rig pa po kun rdzob kyi 'od gsal bar song ba yang sgyu ma'i rnam pas sems rdo rje so sor snang ba'i sku'i rnam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Therefore, the yoginƒ´s, the knowers of the reality of the body, and so on, who have gone into the conventional clear light, also by way of the form of the body of the appearance of the mind-vajra with the aspect of an illusion.üîΩIn the ultimate, give up all the superimpositions and denigrations!

original: don dam par ni thams cad du rgyan btags sgro btags pa thong shig / de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par ni thams cad du rgyan btags sgro btags pa thong shig / de ji ltar zhe na /

original: dbu ma'i tshul zhes bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbu ma'i tshul zhes bya ba gsungs pa /

original: yod min med min yod med min //
analyzed: yod min med min yod med min //

original: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can ma yin //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can ma yin //

original: mtha' bzhi las ni rnam grol ba //üîΩde kho na nyid dbu mar shes //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi las ni rnam grol ba // de kho na nyid dbu mar shes //
translated: It is free from the four extremes.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is known as the middle of reality.

original: de ltar gnas skabs thams cad dang bral pa bzhi pa las 'das pa nges par gzhag pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs slob dpon zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gnas skabs thams cad dang bral pa bzhi pa las 'das pa nges par gzhag pa de nyid kyi gnas skabs slob dpon zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid brtan pa thob //

analyzed: ces bya ba ni bla ma rdo rje 'chang las dpes mtshon par bya ba'i mthar de kho na nyid thob pa'o //

original: de yang ji ltar ma dang pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su dri za'i sems can gyis bde ba nyams su myong ste 'dzag pa'i dus su ni de bzhin du de ltar nye bar ston pa lus 'dzin pa'i dngos pos mngon sum du nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar ma dang pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su dri za'i sems can gyis bde ba nyams su myong ste 'dzag pa'i dus su ni de bzhin du de ltar nye bar ston pa lus 'dzin pa'i dngos pos mngon sum du nyams su myong ngo //
translated: Moreover, just as at the time of the first meditative stabilization, the gandharva being experiences bliss, and at the time of emission, it experiences the same in the same way, it is taught that the master experiences it directly with the substance of the body.

original: de'i rang bzhin du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du 'gro'o //
translated: It goes to that nature.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung @91a * //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung @91a * //

original: pa'o ; / dbu ma chen po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: pa'o ; / dbu ma chen po'i mtshan nyid do //

original: zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sems nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi gzugs thams cad bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta la sogs pa ste de nyid de ltar don dam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sems nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi gzugs thams cad bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta la sogs pa ste de nyid de ltar don dam pa'o //
translated: All conventional forms, such as pots, cloth, chariots, etc., are only bliss and mind.

analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa'i rigs can rnams kyis tha dad so sor yongs su brtags so //

original: de ltar gang kun rdzob de don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gang kun rdzob de don dam pa ste /

original: gang zhig don dam pa ni kun rdzob tu bde ba dang sems dag gis lus dang bde ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig don dam pa ni kun rdzob tu bde ba dang sems dag gis lus dang bde ba'o //

original: 'o na de ltar bye brag smra ba la sogs pa grub pa'i mtha' bzhi de rnams kyi spyod yul bla ma'i gdams ngag de'i tshe thams cad phyi rol par 'gyur ro //

translated: Well then, if the four philosophical systems of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika and so on are the domain of experience of those with guru‚Äôs instructions, then all of them will be outsiders.

analyzed: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi chos la dbye ba med par 'gyur zhe na / de la ji ltar bla ma /

translated: However, it is not the domain of the pa·πá·∏çitas is not the domain of those who delight in dry sophistry, those who are devoid of the holy path, and those who are pa·πá·∏çitas in name only.üîΩ

analyzed: byang chub ster ba po rnyed par dka' ste sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: However, it is not the domain of the panditas means that this wisdom is not the domain of those who delight in dry logic, those who are devoid of the holy path, and those who are fake panditas. It is the domain of the Buddha, the bestower of perfect, complete enlightenment, which is difficult to attain.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /

original: gsungs pa ; grub mtha' mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ; grub mtha' mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad kyi shes bya dang ye shes la sogs pa'i gzugs te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las dmigs pa'o //
translated: Here, the object of knowledge of all phenomena is the form of wisdom and so forth, which is observed through direct perception and inference.

analyzed: de rig pa ni mkhas pa ste shes bya dang ye shes kyi gzugs can gyi bla ma'o //
translated: One who knows that is a scholar, a guru who has the form of the object of knowledge and wisdom.

original: ma rig pa ni mkhas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni mkhas pa ma yin te /
translated: Ignorance is not being a scholar.

original: grub pa'i mtha' mngon sum pa shes bya tsam la brten pa'i spyod pa lta bu'i sgra tsam gyi rjes su rig pa tsam gyis dam pa'i chos kyi nges pa mi shes so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' mngon sum pa shes bya tsam la brten pa'i spyod pa lta bu'i sgra tsam gyi rjes su rig pa tsam gyis dam pa'i chos kyi nges pa mi shes so //
translated: One does not understand the certainty of the holy Dharma by mere knowledge that follows mere words, like the conduct based on mere objects of knowledge in the philosophy of direct perception.

original: dmus long lta bu'i skyes bus dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba de bzhin du mi shes so //
analyzed: dmus long lta bu'i skyes bus dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba de bzhin du mi shes so //

translated: The yoginƒ´s‚Äô gnosis by which the faculties, etc., are generated in that way,üîΩthe gnosis that is the cause of the faculties, etc., is the great yoginƒ´.

translated: Therefore, the ‚Äúlotus seal‚Äù is the gnosis that is the nature of the various parts of the wheel, which is the female, abiding like a wheel, at the time of the seal.üîΩThe ‚Äúlotus seal‚Äù is explained as the seal of the lotus because it is the seal of the lotus of the yoginƒ´s‚Äô wheels, since gnosis is made into its nature.

original: rin po ches sdom pa'i ye shes ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi 'og dang steng ngag tu ltung ba dang / 'degs pa dang thim pa nyid las rin chen sngom pa'o //

original: khyab bdag ces bya ba ni thams cad mdor bsdus pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ye shes gcig pu 'dres par song ba nyid pas gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'o //

original: de'i phyir sngon du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor goms pas nor bu las slar mgo bo'i dpral ba kha 'og tu bltas pa'i ha'i rnam pa'i bar du son pa ste /

translated: Likewise, by abandoning the speech of the letter tha, that is, by abandoning the conceptual thoughts of the first, that is, the conceptual thoughts of existence, nirvana, and so on, at that time, the various phenomena
